content: hey, as we talked in the last meeting, I've created a Github project to track all the work we are trying to do you can see the project here https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-guide/projects/2
@WG-learning please check it out and in particular check that the In Progress column represent the current state
in particular @Amanjeev Sethi are you working on 3 lectures?
that's perfectly fine if you want to do so, just wanted to be sure
Thank you @Santiago Pastorino ! I created three issues but I will work on one at a time.
I cannot move the issues from In progress to To do etc?
@Amanjeev Sethi I guess the best thing is if you have just one
we can unassign you from the rest and move the other two to To do
I guess that's better and also allow others to pick from those issues that are not really in progress
otoh if we see somebody taking those issues that you wanted to work on, we can try to convince that person to take others :)
No it is completely fine. I am sorry. I guess I was just going through the list and did not realize that I should take only one.

No it is completely fine. I am sorry. I guess I was just going through the list and did not realize that I should take only one.

don't worry, it's fine
I think it's just a way to describe what's going on by having only assigned the ones that somebody is actually making progress on them
